channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nothing Launches Its New Headphone (1)... With A Little Bit Of Help From KEF
item.description: Nothing’s first-ever pair of over-the-ear headphones combine the brand's classic expressive design couple with sound shaped by KEF and a uniquely tact...

item.title: Senate Kills 10-Year State-Level AI Ban Tucked In Trump’s Budget Bill
item.description: Consumer and child safety groups applaud Senate’s rare 99-1 vote to protect states’ right to police artificial intelligence.

item.title: Nothing Phone (3) Revealed: The iPhone Chaser’s Most Advanced, Innovative Phone
item.description: At an event in London, Nothing revealed its flagship handset, the Phone (3). From updates to the Glyph interface to four 50-megapixel cameras, here’s ...

item.title: Glyph Matrix On Nothing Phone 3: Everything You Can Do With The New Interface
item.description: The new Nothing Phone 3 trades its signature Glyph Lights for a new interface called Glyph Matrix and it comes with Glyph Toys.

item.title: Netflix Will Livestream NASA Rocket Launches Starting This Summer
item.description: NASA+ live programming — from rocket launches and spacewalks to views of Earth from the ISS — will stream ad-free on Netflix globally starting this su...

item.title: Versions of reality
item.description: A sea slug sees far more colors than you do, and you probably see more than a profoundly color-blind person. Who’s right? We each carry our own versio...

item.title: Daydream fatigue
item.description: Spend enough time inventing possible futures in your head and you won’t have any time to build the future we will all share. Time to get to work.

item.title: A billion choices
item.description: Game theory has a lousy name. When most people think of games, they think of commercial stuff for kids, like Chutes and Ladders or possibly Monopoly. ...

item.title: Education is free, learning is expensive
item.description: That’s a complete reversal of how it used to be. Colleges used to be measured by how many books they had in the library. Access to courses was restric...

item.title: As hot as possible
item.description: At sea level, water boils at 100 degrees C. It doesn’t matter how much more heat you use, steam is what you get. It turns out that water this hot make...
